resource.chars:
Cysticercus, at any rate in some cases 
Lewkail[?] again by feeding <s>a<\s> white mice with the 
ripe ova of Taenia, has caused them to become 
infested with Cysticercus - while the converse 
experiments of Siebold have demonstrated 
the convertibility of Cysticercus, Coenurus and 
Echinococcus into Taenia -
I do not think that any paper on the subject in which these 
observations are not duly weighed and taken into
account should be published - on the other
hand however, I think that Mr Rainey’s
observations if further worked out (with a 
knowledge of what has been done and what 
remains to be done) - will in all probability lead 
to very interesting results - <s>It is quite 
possible within <\s> The known <s>method of development <\s> increase 
of Bucephalus polymorphus and allied forms 
gives some analogical ground for supposing 
that Taenia in its Cysticercus form may multiply & increase 
in modes not at present understood - and the 
discovery of any such modes would be of no 
less importance & interest practically than 
physiologically 
T. H. Huxley FRS
The Committee of Papers 
Royal Society 
Mr Huxleys Report 
on Mr Raineys Paper
